sent_text: The lobby was super busy and I found that a little disconcerting and impersonal.
I'm glad I stayed here but not sure that I would again.
This is a must stay even for most one night to use the infinity pool.
We had a view of the gardens by the bay and when it was lit up at night it was purely magical.

I wanted to stay at the iconic Marina Bay Sands but was not sure that the price would offset the expiernce and through my travels, i have found these types of super high end resorts dont always have the personal touch.
From check in to room service to the concierge - all first class.
I found out that Michael Lee was VP of
We stayed 4 nights here for our honeymoon, we wanted to go with the cliche accommodation in Singapore for our first visit outside of Changi airport.
Good luck also on getting a lounge to put your towel on whilst you
It was my firstime to visit Singapore for a 3 days only.
But I'd rather not to sleep and be on the streets walking around the beautiful city lights of #SG.Nextday still awake until i get my visa on the 3rd day.
Singapore always has a clean environment that i could tell.
From the local people to all there surrounding are such incredibly inseparable.
Seeing Merlion and Marina Bay was a happy moment for me.
I guess one day will be back again here.
Sadly i just missed universal studio which is everyone's landmark.
Well theres always a time for everything.
For all people wants to visit SG you will have fun.
Not a big country but a very big heart and talented Singaporean local  people u met.
All areas spotless & attention to detail is evident everywhere...
One day our room was not even cleaned.
When we informed the reception their comment was: maybe you had the "do not disturb" button on.
The last evening we ordered 2 pizzas, one of them was burnt.
Bars, restaurants and the pool couldn’t fault it
This place has it all!
Shopping, light shows, great restaurants.
I loveit here!
We booked for Easter 2019 to stay 5 nights in a deluxe garden view room.
We wish we had only booked for 3 nights as that was more than enough.
Needless to say, the hotel was very busy and with 2500 rooms and lots of day visitors, the lobby was always busy.
If you want a pool you can swim in or have available beds by the pool, stay somewhere else.
I went to this hotel again after a few years and they have not kept their standard.
The pool water was green.
We checked out immediately and went to a different hotel.
quite crowded on the promenade, could be a better view from top floor.
Hotel charges tourists a whopping fee per person for a short visit to skydesk.
instead a one day stay could be a better deal.
one has to walk a lot in Singapore. must plan for a weeks stay minimum to see few of the attractions and part of the city.
Thogh the MRT & busses networks excellent one must have  budget for taxis as well.
research well for food.
We stayed 2 of the 6 nights at MBS to experience the benefits of staying at MBS, that is to swim in THAT pool, like everyone else!
However the hotel itself is already dated (still have to pay for movies) plus it is a big hotel, so the expectation of good service comes with apprehension.
The TV in our room would freeze occasionally but we could not be bothered getting any help as we felt it would take ages to get someone to come.
The environment is very sober for the tourist.
As for the pool it wasn't as busy as i thought so we had no problems finding sun loungers and room for the selfies!!
, they have bar staff coming round serving snacks and drinks ( yes expensive)
sllo how we gonna chatt & drink they will be outside while we are inside the pool.
But when we are in our country a day after we left Singapore they emailed me that they will charged me a drink because it was not in their fridge.
I told them i will not pay for it coz i asked them before i left Marina.
We are staying in Thailand and decided to fly down to Thailand to celebrate my wife’s 40th Birthday so splashed out on the Marina Bay Sands.
Spending an afternoon in the infinity pool was something we’ll remember for the rest of our lives.
It’s a must stay when visiting Singapore.
The prices on the 'in-room' dining menu were equally awesome, breakfast for two was over $100.
Dinner at the roof top restaurant was over $400, a G&T $22 each, a bottle of wine that you might pay $15-$18 in Australia will cost you over $AUD125.
The shopping mall mentioned in previous reviews does have the most exclusive brand names in the world however, it is way to expensive to shop there.
I did not see one customer in any of the 'top end' shops.
You will need ro get a taxi to and from this hotel on every occasion that yo.u wish to see any of the many sights of Singapore.
It is too remote to walk anywhere.
Good luck if
They even got me an HDMI cord so i could connect my computer to the TV.
The breakfast served daily was a lavish buffet every morning.
The pool on the last floor is the icing on the cake .
The view is extraordinary.
The overall property is itself a luxurious stay .
Marina bay is a must visit property when in singapore
The Infinity pool is a must for everybody to experience.
My husband and 2 kids (7 and 3yrs old) stayed at the incredible Marina Bay Sands for 4 nights as a stop over before going to Maldives.
This hotel is absolutely incredible and very unique.
There is a wide variety of restaurants and in room dinning options.
The hotel has everything you need plus more.
The service was always above and beyond from the moment you step out of the car to check in and check out.
We really didn't want to leave.
Other fabulous hotels in Singapore, and the Sands is like
An amusement park.
So crowded with families with children and the pool is a ZOO.
A must see of this iconic resort.
Real life meet the movie.
High end all the way.
I would like a pillow menu next time ad the pillow was not to my taste !
I have stayed at the Marina Bay twice before but this time was exceptional.
and we were there with a party of 9 people including family and friends of ages between 25 & 60.
As guests we had free access to the rooftop swimming and dining area.
Top tip - go club!
This was the second of three hotels we stayed at for our holiday in Singapore, and we chose it mainly so we could access the rooftop pool.
It is worth saying though, the hotel complex is absolutely huge and very busy, so may not be everyone's cup of tea.
We checked our suitcase in, as we thought as it was 12pm, our room wouldn't be ready.
Can be chaotic, despite the best efforts of the very helpful staff.
Ignore all this (you can't change it) and treat each tower as 1 hotel.
2 extra large single beds, massive shower, immaculate house keeping, mini bar, iron, automatic curtains, large tv, air con,  even a phone in the loo!
Ok, it's not cheap.
We will be back MBS!
It has a large shopping center connected, with connection to the metro just next to everything.
no doubt yes.
Top tip, if you pay to go to the observation floor you have to buy tickets and there are no benefits on that floor apart from amazing view.
If you buy tickets for the Sky Bar which is in the 57th floor they give you vouchers to the same value as your tickets which you can spend at the bar, so in reality the view costs you nothing.
Food and drink are available and the views are incredible.
I didn't stay at the hotel but walked through the Lobby as I needed to visit the Skypark.
The hotel is very busy as there are various activities around like the skypark, Garden by the Bay, shoppe at Marina.
Its a must visit for everyone visitin’ Singapore!!
You really get what you pay for at this hotel.
From a luxury hotel like this, it would really be nice if the breakfast was included or even maybe a special deal for hotel guests.
Believe the hype, it is a spectacular hotel.
There is a casino attached, the mall, and the public transport train is there too.
The serve refreshments and ice cream while waiting, which wasn't very long.
Very lumpy like most pull out couches so don't expect anything better.
Our biggest grip was the location of the room.
It looks spectacular and it is.
Looking over Singapore city, the harbour and it’s attractions .
We considered staying at MBS , glad we didn’t, apart from being expensive, the queues at checkin/ checkout were enormous.
In – Check in was a little slow but the staff were coming around with drinks to keep everyone refreshed in the queue.
We arrived early and the room we were told would not be ready for another hour.
The water was cold and the pool was full of people
The 30th is obviously better to see the lighting show and also access the pool on the 57th floor.
The lift servicing the 19th floor terminates at 22, you then change lifts to reach the top, so we spent a great deal of time in and out of lifts!!
Rooms very large, also the bathrooms with double sinks and then toilet and shower each had their own doors,  There are no changing rooms by the pool, but towels are provided.
The room was luxurious with a very comfy bed.
The club lounge on the other hand was good, but not as good as other 5* hotel we have stayed in.
The MBS is like entering a huge shopping mall with a hotel on the upper floors...
It's not like you're going to admire the skyline or garden for hours on end from your top floor suite...
but there's less choice of food.
If you're willing to pay extra money while in Singapore, then I do recommend this place.

Our flight leaving Singapore wasn’t until late at night and they were able to store our luggage with access to it whenever we needed and also offered us a room to shower so we weren’t sticky from being outside all day before catching our flight.
Con: the infinity pool is filled with kids splashing around everywhere making it
The room itself was very spacious with a king sized bed, TV/console divider, and then a double pull out couch for the kids.
Be sure to sign up for the Sands rewards card for
Yes, maybe it hasn't the colonial atmosphere you would like in a hotel in Singapore.
Yes, sometimes it looks like an aiport lounge.
We arrived at 8am and checkin was so fast.
Our room was not ready and we took a visit at Gardens by the Bay.
Lunch at Satay by the bay (very good!), back to hotel at 2pm and lift to infinity pool (WOW!!!).
I arranged a surprise Singapore trip for my husband’s birthday and as a once off been able to stay at MBS was icing on the cake.
Firstly through all my research I found booking directly through MBS website was the cheapest and easiest.
We arrived back at 2:30pm to check in and the line was very short, I didn’t wait for more than 5 minutes.
We were located on the 37th floor with views of Gardens by the Bay and it was breath taking, especially at night.
Drinks are expensive but not much more than you would pay in any 5 start hotel and whilst charged $56 to go to the top it is given back to you with drinks.
We were not allowed into the pool area as we were not guests but saw lot's of people in gowns coming from the pool and they looked happy.
In my personal opinion, the hotel is like a Mall, with a lot of people, the check in process is not very fluent, even though we were offered water and Ice creams while waiting, still slow.
If you want to swim in the famous pool, you must stay in the hotel, besides that, the hotel is more an tourist attraction than a place to rest and enjoy the city.
However, due to it being so popular it does have a 'conveyer belt' feel to the stay.
There are always masses of people checking in and out and pool itself gets very hectic.
The rooms are very nice and well kept, but nothing exceptional.
It's definitely exciting to stay there and enjoy the facilities, but it's not a luxury hotel experience!
Worth the money
Hotel is what one might expect- a gorgeous, overpriced wonder with everyone taking photos at the pool.
The room size was spacious.
Overall, I don’t regret staying here but would consider a different hotel for my future Singaporean travels.
Once the novelty of the pool and architecture wears off, the value of staying here take a plunge for me.
My wife and I had a 3 night stop over in Singapore and set 1 night aside to stay here as it was something we had wanted to do for years.
Our experience was extremely disappointing and left us wishing we had just stayed at the Pan Pacific where we spent the the 2 nights previous and was by far a better hotel.
I’m guessing they reserve the best service for those arriving in Bentley’s or who are wearing Rolex’s.
The room was very underwhelming and the hotel had the fell of a shopping mall.
I’m sure my review would have been better if it wasn’t for the atrocious service
Due to the size of the hotel be prepared to wait to be checked in.
Otherwise the room looks pretty average.
What was nice was the electric blinds theat open automatically as soon as you enter the room, 3 ply toilet tissue and the TWG tea bags but no bidet in the toilet.
You can tell from the skypark this is no ordinary hotel.
Our room was cleaned several times a day.
I left ex gratia for the housekeeping every time
It's absolutely on the pricey side but with the kind of service we've experienced, I wouldn't mind coming back.
The hotel can be quite busy at time with long queues at checking or check out but we were spare those by check-in in the room.
Even you can't afford to stay in this hotel, there are things you can do at low cost or no cost.
This is a must stay for anyone who loves to travel.
From the moment you walk in you are treated with royalty.
I have no complaints at all about this place.
Iryn was on your first day but done a spectacular job nevertheless.
Check in is slow, the large foyer is currently under constructions will likely be more welcoming when completed.
We had booked two rooms and we were split on to different floors (irritating)
Elevators are also slow and you need to swipe room key wait for board to flash and then press floor.
We paid for the premium rooms and one certainly was - the other was not.
Floor 29 had sweeping views of the gardens from the verandah.
The toiletries are very high quality.
Singapore is so hot and humid I don’t want to leave the hotel.
Minus one star when we got off taxi nobody came to help us with our luggage.
I told the front desk and couple guys were free standing around.
When booking this hotel I had doubts that it would be worth as much per night as a Ritz Carlton and Mandarin Oriental (all are on the Marina Bay).
I was expecting them to say the room wasn't ready, but they were very accommodating and gave me a room right away.
Upon entering the room I could see why this is a 5-star hotel.
Second, the POOL is INCREDIBLE!
I am not a huge sit by the pool and do nothing person, but here, I spent hours in the pool and sitting by it.
Where else can you be 57 floors up swimming around looking over the city?!
The pool alone is worth spending
Twin bed too small to sleep with kids.
Should be queen size for that.
Pool was crowded as expected.
Spago cocktails and sushi quite good but not special enough for the prices.
If you haven't had a chance to stay in this hotel, then you should do.
The pool itself is spectacular and a must see if you’re in Singapore.
Cocktails are delish and
From the moment we entered the foyer the service was second to none.
You become part of the other 5000 people staying there.
Once inside good luck finding where you are meant to check in, especially if you pay the extra for a club room.
Once you get to your room be ready to be dissapointed.
Club rooms with garden view are smaller than rooms on the other side of the hotel (cleverly you are shown the large room even if you book a garden room... naughty).
The infinity pool is impossible to get to with every man and his selfie stick vying for space.
Trying to find a spot for a drink in the evening which felt luxurious was impossible.
What a hotel.
The architecture, rooms, views and staff are incredible.
Didn't want to leave here.
Best way I can describe MBS is if McDonald’s was a hotel it would be Marina Bay Sands.
It genuinely feels like a drive through.
Architecturally it’s a marvel of engineering but it lacks the most important bit... personality.
Those pesky Russians and their desire to wear the hotel provided robe and slippers from their hotel room on level 4 all the way to the pool on level 57.
Too popular with tourists.
Shops aligned are high class.
We decided to stay here for one night during our recent visit to Singapore, it lived up to all our expectations and more.
The hotel offers so much to see and do.
Pool is good but far too busy.
There are many better options in Singapore.
You cannot miss it, with its three tall towers with boat strung across the three towers.
4 friends visited Ce la vi club lounge for drinks.
Stayed at the Marina Bay Sands on a 3 night trip for a friends birthday.
Checking in was no problem and our room was up graded.
The pool does get very very busy but it is a must to visit and see Singapore from a high height.
Try happy hour!!!!!
You have to stay there to actually use the infinity pool but outside guests can go to the top to take pictures without being in the pool.
Though definitely luxurious
and we don't gamble and we thought it the location was just so-so.
We moved to a boutique hotel in Chinatown afterward and liked that vibe a lot more.
But to be honest, that's it.
The hotel is way too big and you have the feeling of being on a market rather than in a five star hotel.
There are much better places to stay in Singapore if you are looking for beautiful and luxurious rooms as well as personalized and polite service (e.g., Raffles, InterContinental, Fullerton).
We also visited the bar and the drinks were average (if at all).
Interestingly, however, the bar keeper did not engage with us nor was he friendly above average, but he gave everyone a card with his name asking to write a positive TripAdvisor review about him.
big rooms with all amenities.
Staff are so attentive everything is thought of and when needed so prompt in their service.
I was lucky enough to spend nearly a week at the stunning Marina Bay Sands at a work conference.
There is a massive shopping centre below (some high street but mainly high end!) and lots of restaurant choices - my favourite was Lavo.
I would definitely splash out to spend another night in this gorgeous spot!!
Accessible from any part of Singapore by Taxi Rooms are not only bigger in size but have fabalous view.
However because of its size and modern design it is more like a hub than a luxury hotel.
Other than that, the restaurants and service is second to none.
However, we found that if you did not arrive at Club 55 right on 5pm, you often could not get a seat and so missed out on the drinks/nibbles included in your room price.
Also, although the infinity pool offered great views it was soooooo crowded, and getting a seat was virtually impossible.
Our room was oversized and had a 12'x12' balcony overlooking the Gardens by the Bay.
The hotel has a huge shopping and restaurant area and casino.
You can get lost here!
The infinity pool on the 57th floor in the Skypark is something that you just have to see.
The architecture is spectacular, views are spectacular, the pool is spectacular.
The pool area is very crowded.
So we ticked this one off our list of places too visit and enjoyed the spectacularness of the place.
All were exellent.
Room was clean,well firnished.
Moreover, the queues for the registration to the hotel was very big (for those who take the lounge access they have another queue in another room which is great and fast).
Just got to see the sound and light show from our room.
Just spent three days at Marina Bay Sands, very big hotel with lots and lots of people, rooms are  quite spacious.
Breakfast very expensive $100 for two people.we went over to the shopping centre and had dinner at The Nostra Cucina restaurant we had pizza and it was lovely, great service as well.
The hotel is central and within walking distance to most sights.
The restaurants are really good however they can be very expensive and close early therefore it is better to check on arrival times etc.
The pool area can be very full particularly in the evening and regardless of if you have a bed and personal belongings on them people will still try to sit on them while you are in the pool.
The reception area is large with adjoining shops, walkway to the gardens, restaurants etc therefore it can get extremely busy
so you don't get the personnel feel that it's a hotel.
Stopped in Singapore on my way to Koh samui and just had to come see what a the hype is about ...
I would hope to one day check in as a guest !
Don’t forget to take a number when you arrive and enjoy the free water or coffee whilst you wait.
Booked the executive package and no waiting around for check in.
No queues for elevators and yes the pool was busy in the afternoon so best avoided as lots of screaming children running around.
We went for a swim at 2100 and again at 0600 and it was bliss, much quieter than the day and no problems finding a poolside lounger.
It is a jaw dropping hotel.
She checked us into the room booked and then said to give her a few minutes.
She managed to give us as city facing room on a really upper floor.
What a hotel  Go on treat yourself.
From the start you could tell this hotel is overpriced with quality lacking.
The check in was slow and long.
Felt like I was queuing for a Ryanair flight.
The room was starting to look run down as it clearly has not been touched up since the venue opened 9yrs ago.
Definitely not 5* compared to other hotels in Singapore.
It was extremely busy around sunset with no loungers free.
Loungers are cramped next to each other and the again the pool is not big enough too accomodate everyone wanting to take selfies etcs during peak periods.
Making the stay more worth it!
World’s Best and pricey hotel.
At the duration of the stay, we get legit luxurious treatment.
All  the staff are VERY accommodating.
From baggage, check-in, room service, Club 55 service, pool, Spagoo, check out, operator.
Hats off to all the hardworking staff.
She got two birthday cakes.
From Club 55 plus a birthday song, then another one delivered to our room.
Infinity pool is a sight to behold.
We stayed on the 7th floor which you would think isn’t too high, it was definitely high enough to see the gardens of the bay every day from your window!
Our suite was incredible complete with pool table cloakroom and full bathroom.
The infinitely pool and the shopping area was my favourite .The

Anyway leaving a review here wouldn’t make a diff anyway as their management team will only copy paste a standard reply to everyone as this hotel is way too commercialised compared to when they first launched it.
Service is certainly not 5 stars - hotel is so big seriously nobody knows you.
Upon check in the attendant upgraded us to the 36th floor with garden view.
The pool area which only hotel guests are allowed in is beyond words.
We booked a garden bay view room and it absolutely lived up to its name!
The room itself was above average.
They gave us not the bay view room we paid for, repeatedly they tried to tell us that garden view was bay view but could not respond to our question where the difference in price came to be.
We are currently waiting at the front desk and nobody wants to help, either they say nobody is there or available at the moment.
As Low floor does not direct access to the pool.
The poolside, thread bare towels and way too crowded.
Room was very spacious and quite luxurious.
Exceeded our very high expectations.
However, be prepared for hordes of people (there are around 2500 rooms in three towers); and forget about actually swimming in the rooftop pool!
The restaurants in the hotel and the shopping complex are over-priced, so best to check out the many other choices in Singapore.
The infinity pool is without a doubt the best thing about this hotel and is worth a visit during the day and also at night.
Our bags made it quickly to our room and checkin was a breeze.
You pay an entrance fee of about S$45 however you redeem this against your drinks (if you remember... unlike us who had to get more drinks to use the voucher!)
We didn't book breakfast, but there are so many top end shops...cafes...street food...bistros ...that there was no need!
The star of the show is the rooftop Pool, spanning all 3 Towers on the 57th floor!
The infinity pool opens at 6am, and getting there as early as possible is well worth it.
You get the pool almost to yourself, and watching the dawn from the roof is an experience you won't get anywhere else.
We first stayed at Marina Bay Sands not Long after it opened and to be honest although it was/is an amazing hotel the service let it down.
Never had a service like this before in other hotels.
although this Hotel isn't rated the best in Singapore, it is for me.
The rooms are spacious and I selected a view of Gardens on the Bay.
The infinity pool is a must see.
And yet for me it was just slightly missing the atmosphere and service one usually expects in a 5 Star hotel.
Personally the sheer size means the service not quite up there with say a Shangri-La or Conrad.
The hotel has an enormous shopping mall, a casino, a unique pool on the top roof over looking Singapore.
Not acceptable way to treat hotel guests.
Hotel nice but huge and very impersonal
I have no problem with the room.
Marina Sands Hotel is structurally impressive, however you are one of 1000s there.
One of the worlds top hotels imo.
World famous hotel , unique design, next to garden by the Bay
Many high end designer boutique and restaurant , casino at the lower level  convenient , public train MRT is next to hotel .
I can't help feel that it would be better to stay at another hotel across the way and be able to look at this incredible building rather than stay in it!
On arrival I was surprised at the check in queue and check in experience.
Felt like an airport terminal, no attempt is made to make you feel welcome or special.
Then you traipse with your bags 100s of metres to your tower, get accosted by security guards making sure you’re a guest and not a tourist.
Bathroom was not 5 star, the ceiling had peeling paint and was patched.
The rooftop pool area was packed and the pool was full of guests with selfie sticks.
This is the most prestigious hotel in Singapore.
Pay a bit more and stay in the Premier rooms on the higher floors which gives you this million dollar view from your balcony.
The room was nice, the pool was nice, the breakfast was nice but at any given time you felt like being at Mumbai or Shanghai main train station during rush hour.
My recommendation go for dinner/drink on the roof top and save your money for a less crowded 5 star hotel
phew as we might not have got into the room for another hour.
As far as the room goes and, compared to other hotels that are not nearly quite so “grand” it was okay, not “wow” or fabulous.
The bath robes were pretty ordinary, as were the bath towels; then and small.
There was tea and coffee facilities and a mini bar that charged upon removal; had those
Breaksfast at RISE was from the food point of view ok - but several hundreds of guests without any athmosphere - a continual comming and going - a mass processing.
the hotel itself impressive from the architecture but at ground level busy like a Railway Station
The location cant be beat.
Kind of disappointing when you see how beautiful the rest of the building is.
Rooms are large.
Pool is certainly spectacular but overcrowed.
This hotel has all you ever dreamed off.
We stayed one night, make sure to check in on time to explore everything.
The whole place is like a human zoo.
Too many people not enough staff and an American service attitude that does not work in Asia.
You will also really enjoy Asian hospitality, not some gordy peice of Las Vegas dropped in the middle of Singapore.
The bathroom was modern and inviting....actually the first hotel tub
But lets be real, the rooftop pool is EVERYTHING!
Again, the service was on point.

We got some drinks at the pool which was soooo crowded that we didn’t really enjoyed but was not hotel fault at all but they should have at least an adults only time because was full of kids and some of us we just want to relax.
Like casino, mall, gardens by the bat, bay light show etc.
The reason I keep on coming back is for the sake of the view and the infinity pool.
Hotel is huge and massive which we don;t really feel personalized.
It’s very luxury.
We stayed for one night, but wished it could have been for longer.
just as well we fitted in a trip to the gym at the hotel
Though it looks spotlessly clean, found a strand of hair and rubber band at the shower room which I believe it wasn’t thoroughly  clean.
I do have to say that i have stayed in better but given Singapore i think this is of a high standard for them.
For example when we wanted to go to Gardens by the Bay we asked and we were told a long way round when in fact you can go through the hotel itself.
You can use your keycard to get discount at the shopping centre which isn't really made obvious.
The room we had was fabulous with a veiw to die for overlooking the bay .
Our room was on the 26th floor facing the beautiful gardens.
The room was immaculate!
The lifts: too slow!!
I agree with what sonebody else who wrote in their review that there should be guest only lifts.

Wedding anniversary, 11 years, for my husband and I. Enquired with concierge to see if we were appropriately dressed (in cargo shorts, tee shirt and loafers) to go up to the 57th floor for a glass of champagne and to admire the view.
Lobby seemed crazy/manic.
Got crammed into a lift heading for floor 57.
However, beyond that, I find it difficult to enthuse about it.
The dining facilities are frankly not able to cope with the sheer number of guests.
Yet further, I am fed up with the lifts: every time I want to go up to my room, I have to compete with an army of tourists wanting to travel to the top.
The Management should approve a strict code of behavior for clients, otherwise it is an amusement park , not a luxury Hotel.
Floor was silent, not any noises from the corridor or other rooms.
For a luxury hotel, I was surprised that the beds were so hard.
Also, the gym is very tiny for such a large hotel, so expect to wait for machines.
Overall, there is nothing much that can beat a stay in this hotel.

However this is a very large hotel with a huge number of guests and although the service is good do not expect five star service and if you want a decent room on a high floor it is worth paying for a club room.
The spacious guest room commanded panoramic view of the sea.
For sashimi lovers, the large chunks of tuna and octopus will make the price seem less daunting.
There are also stations dedicated to Indian and local Singaporean dishes.
Unlike other hotels, the dessert spread is substantial, with a chocolate fountain and a make-your-own soda counter.
But for a photophobic local like me, I asked for a shaded
Ours was a 3 star hotel experience and make no mistake this is a MASSIVE hotel with more rooms than the Vatican.
Despite this overwhelming ratio of staff-guest it took a good 13 minutes for our clerk to check us in.
Now if checkout is 11 pm, and we have arrived at 6 pm , having made a booking a month prior, surely someone somewhere would've already allocated a room.
First of all, the lobby was really rowdy and likened “market place”.
The room was more spacious than many 5-star hotels.
However the basic amenities like toiletries were “cheap” looking.
The way drinks in the fridge are secured gave occupants a feeling that they couldn’t be trusted.
The bed was really comfortable but the pillows were too soft.
Gym facility was well equipped and clean; the infinity pool was always busy and unpleasantly crowded.
Food in and around the hotel are definitely pricey; can’t say the quality or variety (esp those restaurants at Level 1) were great.
The scale of the hotel is enormous, with a huge lobby (both in square footage and atrium volume).
However, our room was ok and fell a bit short for a 5 star hotel.
When we addressed to the staff even with a recording of it they dismissed as a nonissue.
As well as the Lavo restaurant is way too expensive for the quality of food
This is a spectacular hotel as the photos show , an architectural wonder!
Be aware this is a huge Hotel There were always lots of people wandering around the foyer.
It made the check in a little slow but not too bad.
This was particularly an issue with the Club access on Friday and Saturday evenings access is from 5pm best not to be late or you face a longish wait.

Wonderful hotel, but no good costumer service, the rooms needs  modernize, clean,no customized services, no welcome, no nobody interested in helping you or at least show   you where is your room, you  pay really for access to the pool...
I've been to other hotels much better.
Nice food but way too expensive for the price you pay to have local food.
Nothing is really cheap here except if you go Zara or the shops selling sporting goods like Adidas and World of Sports.
Mostly meant to target the well to do locals and people who feel they are part of a upper social type.
Be prepared to pay anything from $12 to $18 for a plate of Nasi Padang
I would suggest this location for at least one night for the experience alone.
Room was very large and spectacular views across the lake and city.
Worth a one night stay but price prohibits justifying staying here longer.
We had rooms on the 39th floor with a harbour view which was just magnificant.
The whole experience was well worth the expense.
Be sure to check for current promotions.
Our boarding passes from Singapore Airlines saved us a bunch!
Missing to have your 5 star service!!
The room was spacious
Stayed for 2 nights in the hotel and while it's an architectural marvel the level of service is more along the line of midscale hotels.
Be prepared to que and be prepared to serve yourself.
This was a work trip so it didn’t matter, but I’d recommend upgrading if you are staying on holiday.
The Lobby of the hotel had two different places to check in and out since it has two doors.
The room we got was upgraded to a presidential suite offering 180 degrees view of the city, water front and garden.
The light show was witnessed from the comfort of our own suite.
Very luxurious experience
For sure we were not deceived with the view but the pool water was very cold to swim in.
I can not recommend this hotel and Club 55 highly enough.
From the movement you arrive, the service is second to none, the hotel is thriving with activity and offers options to suit all tastes.
The facilities at the hotel are world class, we took a trip to the casino which was seemless to enter and was a hive of activity inside.
No idea what we did as a family to deserve this, but we may never experience this level of luxury again.
I wasn’t disappointed.
We splurged on a suite and it exceeded my expectations.
The suite was enormous, with an equally large bathroom.
The balcony view it was my favourite area in the hotel.
Negative - 1)

Shower facilities in room are bit basic considering how pricey the rooms are, 2) can be crowded at times especially during the peak holiday season which may dampen the roof top infinity pool experience.
Best time to access are 6-8am or after 8pm
Of course, everyone is blown away by the pool - especially right after a 17hour flight from San Francisco!
However, the excitement starts to fizzle pretty quickly from there.
I would recommend that people go for the experience, leave after the first few days.
Would not recommend a lengthy stay.
You can get discounts there and who knows you’ll be lucky enough to get the cheapest room yet.
By bus: also good
But its better to get there through MRT(from my own experience)
Room is 👌🏻 Amaaazing
The infinity pool is something that has got to be done the views are amazing!!!!
You are merely given discounts in their ridiculously priced restaurants and casino dollars, all 30 of them!
3 nights was way too long and for that money you can stay at better hotels.
Food court was amazing!.
Check-in staff very professional and accommodating.
Almost forgot, the view while you're on the pool on 57th floor is nothing short of spectacular, especially at night.
Definitely worth the extra cost to stay at such an iconic location.
The only negative I could see is that
the hotel for sure is expensive but its definately worth it.
What can be better: - I missed the old bathroom amenities.
The Concierge Desk is not able to get reservations at in-hotel restaurants for hotel guests.
Waiting for Taxis is too long.
The crowd at the Lobby is too large for a Luxury Hotel.
I stayed at this hotel for 1 night with my boyfriend on our stop over to Australia from the UK.
Yes the hotel is not the cheapest to stay at
but I promise its worth every penny spent and is good value for money.
You really do get what you pay for with this hotel <3
Each tower has its own check in desk and you don't want to queue in the wrong one
It’s clearly the most iconic hotel in Singapore but after staying there for two nights in a Club Room, it’s way overrated and overpriced - and thus the rating here at 2 stars.
It was a nice room - but nice in terms of a mid range hotel brand nice.
It’s also just a massive complex that there is no sense of personalisation and you are truly just a number at this hotel.
There is also very little public areas to congregate, sit or wait in the lobby.
The pool was nice but again was underwhelming and rather crowded.
I’d recommend a stay some place else and swing by for a drink on the rooftop at one of their bars.
At breakfast, too, we had to wait in the queue for 20-30 minutes when the omelet was fried,
The reason I gave this title was because these big flash iconic hotels leave me cold.
We didn't eat at the hotel because value for money it is not, it's more of an experience
Massive hotel so you can't expect quiet.
but I easily prefered Ritz Carlton opposite.
Yes it is expensive, but it is worth the money for a one time experience :-)
One of the most iconic hotels in the world, boasting of the worlds largest infinity pool.
The hotel consists of innumerable restaurants but however are pretty full so a reservation might be required.
We visited the Sky Park/infinity pool and it was incredible.
We went for a swim and enjoyed cocktails poolside.
this is now a place only for the rich and the staff made it clear ,very rude and not a pleasant experience .For
a lovely hotel lots of people walking around in dressing gowns (very strange) .last time for us ...
Feedback following a recent two night stay in a twin room in a low room on Tower 1.

However due to the large size of the hotel (which feels more like a conference center) and it’s design, our room was overlooking the reception counter / lobby area at the very front of the building and didn’t feel very private.
We decided to visit the top of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel from the Hop on Hop off bus.
Will never forget.
The hotel is conveniently located near most of the major tourist attractions, so you don't have to travel far if you are only in the city for a couple days.
It would be nice if there were some umbrella to cover some of the chairs, because being up there without any protection from the sun is a little overwhelming.
Beyond the actual room itself, I don't think there's anything special about the hotel.
Definitely very helpful.
It's convenient, plenty of public transport option -
Cons (unfortunately it's a long list)  - Check-in was very slow.
Thought we’d treat ourselves as we had heard the hype about this place.
This place was an absolute nightmare.
Arrived to find essentials 2 tiny double beds for 4 people.
My husband spoke to reception about the fact that it was not suitable for 4 people, even though the website recommended it for 4 people.
They eventually agreed to bring up a fold out bed.
The famous pool up top was absolutely freezing!
I didn’t swim in it once!
One is the spas was closed too.
It was so gross.
There was nothing to do here for families.
it was just your run of the mill standard, nice motel room.
Honestly it is amazing.
but they told us our room was ready at 2pm which was great!), again that night quite late (it shuts at 11pm), and then in the morning around 7am (it opens at 6am but is still dark then).
The best time was the early morning.
Less crowded and an all round nicer experience.
Don’t get me wrong, STILL quite crowded but nothing on the afternoon and evening.
There are photographers in the pool too who will clear a shot for you which is
Free Teatime 2 to 4 pm is ok.
Breakfast is ok.
Worth at least 1 visit for us locals but very crowded, should do weekdays instead of weekends.
Obviously doing very well.
For once in a lifetime, totally worth it.
The infinity pool gets quite busy, if you go first thing at 6am definitely less so.
Expensive and busy, but this place is worth the hype.
Well, I saw pics..thought, yeah right.
and I don’t like cities or people!
Good location, big resort style hotel.
Check in was extremely slow and cumbersome.
It is a very busy place and a tourist attraction in itself.
This doesn’t always help the ambience.
It is difficult for these type of hotels to be truly a “luxury” experience when they are so big and busy.
You get a big balcony overlooking the gardens by the bay which lit up at night.
Staying in MBS gives loads of perks access to the mall and dining.
However, the hotel rooms are small and very expensive.
People go there definitely just want to snap photos at the infinity pool.
However, its not worth it.
You can find a better priced hotels near orchard road with decent stay.
The pool on the rooftop is second to none.
However this is not an inexpensive hotel and given the rates one must pay and expect significantly better rooms.
Wallpaper is coming off in the bathroom there are stains on the wall and I got to bed only to find my comforter full of stains.
The hotel is very large and I had recently had knee surgery so it was hard to get around.
The lobby is immense I felt somwhow lost in it, The check in went well, but I always had the feeling waiting for ages for the elevators.
My mum mentioned it is like a big train station and she was right.
The service was efficient but faceless,
The pool has amazing views but it was crowded as well in the afternoon we could hardly find free sunbeds.
The waters is cold, and if you go to the jacuzzi it is way too hot and I am convinced they do it on pourpse!!
To go up to the top we took advantage of the Ce La Vi bar, were it costs 22SGD to enter the bar.
No brainer really to go to the bar and get your drink that’s included in your ticket price.
Paid $25 for a cocktail that came half full.
The whole experience was unenjoyable.
You are just another number being shipped in and out of this vast cavern.
Wouldn’t return if someone paid me.
the pool us out of this world!
definitely worth it.
We arrived from the airport and had to join a long queue for check in.
To fair the queue went down quite quickly but not really what you expect for that money.
We were early for check in but the check in clerk advised us 'we looked tired' so we could have our room early....
Room was lovely but nothing special but great views and really good a night when everything start to get lit up.
We had a dip in it but to be honest the pool was quite cold.
Unfortunately, it was Chinese New Year when we were there, so the 57th floor rooftop swimming pool was almost standing room only; but now been there, done that, got the photo.
We arrived at 1.30pm and was hoping that we can check-in earlier.
So we had to go to the Tower 3 and it was more than an hour wait till we get to the check-in counter.
Was expecting better treatment as the payment charged is not a joke at all.
The infinity pool is jaw dropping.
I am vegan and found it a little difficult in the hotel but a short walk round the corner found a Gordon Ramsay with a full vegan menu option.
The room we had was garden view and man, what a garden.
The botanical gardens are right outside and at night looked magical.
However, it was very crowded and more like a Vegas experience.
Which is not bad, just not the place to go for a relaxing quiet stay.
Long lines for most things like breakfast and the roof top pool area.
Overall worth a visit once I think.
I will certainly will be back and this time I will make sure I will have a chance to swim in their infinity pools
Stayed in a standard  double room, which I was suprised the rooms are very big.
View to marina bay was unreal!
Gym facilities are below average considering this is meant to be a five star hotel, they need more weights equipment.
Don’t bother swimming because everyone is here for a selfie.
They need better training of the front desk with customer service skills.
You want to stay there.
The Marina Bay is more like a Las Vegas type "five-star" property.
But on your second trip, book a more comfortable hotel at half the price elsewhere......assuming you were able to take that infinity pool pic the first time.

If it's your first time in Singapore, there is no point in staying anywhere else because if you do you will always stare up in envy at this iconic hotel and wonder what it's like to chill out in that ridiculous infinity pool on top--which you can ONLY do if you stay at this hotel.
It was more spectacular than I imagined.
When we went the weather was iffy the whole time and we had more than our share of rain/thunderstorms.
I was stressing that we wouldn't be able to swim but during our whole 4 day stay they only closed it once for 30 minutes due to lightning.
Yes, this place
The inside of the lobby was massive with several eating areas.
So, I plunked down over $500 USD for a Harbor view room on the 2nd to the top floor in the hotel.
Lower floor rooms on the Gardens By the Bay side are cheaper.
Still, everyone goes for the iconic rooftop infinity pool (the highest in the world) and any stay grants you access.
And of course you must visit the pool, but be prepared to act like a shark circling it's prey in order to get a coveted lounge chair.
We were outmaneuvered a couple of times but finally got our chairs!
Do not miss this !
The infinity pool and the service from the staff were also second to none!
Don’t have a bad word to say about Marina Bay Sands and can’t wait to come back!!
There wasn't really any where to so I was glad to have had our pushchair.
The lobby is vast and full of people, far too busy you didn't know who were tourists and who were residents.
The main reason we booked to stay here one night was the pool to be brutally honest.
On the day of the birthday, she has decided no go swim very early morning which quest stressful to me because I have plan for In-Room Dining for her as big surprised.
The price of this hotel was well above what it should be.
The lobby at check in is just a massive scrum of people.
Check in took almost 30 mins.
I just feel the hotel needs a makeover to bring it into the 2019 era and to match the asking price.
But, I guess for most people it’s a chance to ‘check’ themselves in on social media and keep up with the jones’.
We stayed at the Marina Bay Sands for 1 night before our cruise during the Christmas holiday.
It's worth it.
So much to do you can get lost in the hotel!
Check in on line and save the line!
The hotel is okay, construction and architecture is not really high quality, its more for attract tourist people.
This is a 5-star hotel, but we found the property just couldn't handle crowds.
Or, wait times in general and massive cattle herding.

The room was fantastic, however we found little annoyances - the TV remote did not work, the window shade motor bugged out every time we activated the room power, and the mandarins they gave us has big mold spots.
So, not perfect.
Shout out to Gina!
We came here for one night and I must say it was a great disappointment for the amount of money we spent.
1.The lobby is like a market place - noisy and crowded.
There is nowhere to sit and relax eg while waiting for someone.
2.The check in and check out is atrocious- service is absolutely slow and understaffed.
For a hotel of this reputation and standard I do not expect to be standing in line to check in for over 20 minutes.
We have stayed in much better hotels in Singapore for a lot less than half that!
Had a wonderful stopover at the Marina Bay.
Singapore in general was a bit of a surprise.
I’ve been to MBS several times already but only doing the review now maybe because I get used to the hotel already but our last stay this Feb was a superb staycation.
The hotel as usual is crowded at the lobby, specially the check in and out counter hope they can do something about this.
Will definitely visit MBS when I will be in SG again.

Our only disappointment was dinner at Lavo, an Italian/American themed restaurant, the service was so quick our meal was served immediately we had ordered which suggested that it was very much prepared, certainly not by a chef and it was very expensive.
Besides that, not everything in marina bay sands is neither expensive, however there is also certain shops that sells affordable items that fullfill your own personal needs!
So don’t forget to visit MBS, Singapore!
Foodhall dussapointing though .
If you want to stay in an architectural icon roughly on par with .....
Its bustling night and day and  if tranquility is what you're after this might not be the place for you.
This alone, made it worth it after a 15 or 16 hour flight. .

More like a business class hotel.
Big, dual sinks, enormous walk-in shower and
Hard to want to go anywhere else!
Food prices are high as well as wine.
Architecture buildings here are one of the best in Asia.
High end fashion brands easily found here.
We decided to stay in that hotel because of infinity pool.
For sure it is not a place for holiday.
Firstly the checkin was overcrowded and took 20 to get to the front of the line.
The hotel seemed overcrowded with people.
Personnel is costumer oriented.
They are just way too busy to be of help.
Room are nice but small for the $.
Yes the pool is great and the view 5 star, its the screaming kids and parents that spoil the show.

So if we had to do over, spend a couple of hundred less on different 5 star hotel, or if your determined to spend the $650 per night, you can rent a whole sweet at say the inter continental hotel and get the service that should come with that price point.
The real plus was of course the rooftop pool!
The staff is very attentive and discreet.
Unfortunately visited here as a multiple sight seeing tour.
It would have been lovely to spend some time up there
Fabulous views, recommend you allow plenty of time and do this venue independently.
I felt like this hotel was a must do, although mega pricey!
We arrived around 10am and started to queue for check-in, it was very busy and quite slow like many of the reviews on here have said.
The staff definitely seemed aware of this though
and we were taken through to the VIP check-in to speed things along.
As check in isn't until 3pm we were told our room wasn't ready but we were given temporary key cards to be able to access the pool area and we told we would be emailed when our room was ready.
This was fine for us as our plan was to get out ASAP to see the city.
There is a hop on hop off bus stop right outside the hotel which was ideal for us as we wanted to see as much as possible and
I recommend booking in advance to have breakfast on the top floor.

Such a pity because I enjoyed the hotel rooms and all the surrounding amenities, but the treatment we received from the pool and security staff put a huge stain on our whole experience at the Marina Bay Sands.

IMO, if a person pays extra $$ to get 2x nicer rooms for 5 star luxury (as promised), then maybe the hotel should invest in training their staff to provide 5 star customer service or at least teach them reasonable dispute resolution skills.

Upon check-in (with a family of 5 AND 2 elderly grand parents) we were advised that our 2x booked rooms could not be adjoined and that only one room was available to us, forcing a 2 hr wait for the 2nd room to open up.
That was not a problem for us as we understood how busy MBS was at the time, so we happily accepted their offer of
Nice touch folks.
We booked into a Garden View King on L30 and our room was marvellous.
Sleek, contemporary and spotless.
If you like a city view then go right ahead.
Yes but you do get your money's worth.
A dip in the Infinity pool is a must

The main criticism is the menu in the pool area needs a lot of improvement, and while you expect a place like this to be overpriced, the prices really were over the top for what you get, and the service was below average.
Amenities were just beyond your reach!
Stayed at the inconic Marina Bay Sands during a short stop over in Singapore, in an executive room with a view of the harbour.
We arrived at 9 AM and our requested room type (Grand Club) was not ready but we were given a pass to use the pool area and were told that we would get an email when the room was ready.
No problem because we were heading off to meet up with friends to explore the city so we checked our luggage.
When we were arrived back, we were told that we had been upgraded to a 52nd floor Orchid Suite with a garden view.
There were multiple universal plug outlets and USB ports for charging.
You can walk everywhere from here as well !!!
Of course Singapore are very safe and clean country!!
It was a small dream or a big wish to stay in MBS..
Well, this beautiful hotel was all that I wanted on this trip....
Coming to the hotel, the check in was smooth & quick...
The staff helped me to the room...
To my surprise, I was given a written apology for a delay of may be 4-5 mins in sending my luggage.
The room was lavish & the view was spectacular.
Well connected & the elevator to the infinity pool is in the same tower.
but they were so small they’re not worth a mention.
We ate there a few times and the food was exceptional.
The pool is busy but is something you MUST do, even if it’s just to take a photo.
Views were amazing.

It is kind of pricey, but well worth it.

Large bathtub and shower.
The staff makes this 5 stars experience.
The location is very good, you can do everything by foot or by bike.
It is like a scene from Avatar.
The hotel lobby is crowded and everything is so huge, it's not a hotel you want to stay for more than a few days I guess.
But for a couple of days it's great, especially the Skypark with the rooftop swimmingpool, the restaurants and bars.
After travelling for a month and staying in hostels I decided to treat myself to two nights at the Marina Bay.
I ordered room service on the first night, which was very tasty!
However, although the view at the top was great, i am never satisfied with my infinity pool experience.
😱 You can't really relax anymore.
It is too crowded for me.
From the 40 floor we had an incredible view of the Garden by the Bay especially in the night when everything is lighted.
A very big breakfast variety at Rise Restaurant.
Infinity pool is moderately crowded (it's not a canned sardine experience like some people say it is)
We spent all day by the pool (1pm - 8pm) and even had dinner there - the views are incredible.
Clearly the building is a Singapore landmark.
Furthermore the building is so big that it lacks a personal touch.
Cool experience though I will not come back
Afternoon tea was provided from 2-4 and complimentary drinks(including alcoholic beverages) and canopies from 5-7pm.

The rooftop infinity pool is spectacular with many lounge chairs, although few by the pool
We asked in the Hotel at the Concierge desk for a Electronic scooter and they did not make an effort to help us or to find a help for our friend.
Check-in was fluid as we arrived earlier.
It's too expensive but the rooms are dated.
Housekeeping/room service boys just barge in your room without knocking and they did not even say sorry.

The rooms are fine, although nothing special.

Bar/restaurant at the top.
To get to the gym or pool we had to go down across the lobby and then back up a different elevator..not great design.
Upon arrival, check-in was quick and effortless.
Happy to report that there was no smoke smell in the lobby which is often a problem with hotels attached to casinos.
I never went in the casino, so I am not sure they even permit smoking in the casino.
Excellent facilities and amenities but soulless in service and atmosphere.
The hotel itself is fairly standard, nothing particularly outstanding besides the rooftop infinity pool.

From the outset, there were mixed feelings about the whole experience, the bell boys on arrival are so rushed and over worked that we had to drag our bags to to check in after 16 hours of flying and arriving into 35 degree soaring heat, the check in experience itself is hectic and feels like you are at an airport and results in reaching the counter and the usual form filling (I don't know why in this day and age we still do this, why can this not be done in advance - especially at a 'top hotel').
If youâ€™d like to share a pool with a billion other selfie taking people this is your spot.
Check in is like checking into a budget airline.
Rooms are hugely outdated and the general feel of the place is pretty chaotic and underwhelming for the enormous price tag.
We stayed at a night at Marina Bay Hotel to gain access to infinity pool because otherwise you can't reach.
After much discussion, lasting half an hour, we were eventually allocated an upgraded room with a view of the park and harbour.
We had been here to enjoy Sky bar on rooftop.
Walking distance to so many attractions and restaurants.
Stood waiting for acknowledgement but the young lass was to busy texting.
As mentioned previously it appears now the current generation of young workers are more interested in their status than their jobs.
Food is spectacular, even if you eat at food court, which I did a lot.
We arrived with lost luggage (lost in Rome) and the Concierge staff put that as a priority to assist tracking down our luggage and get it to the Hotel.
Breakfast is a feast unto itself.
The room view is incredible.
Incredible location, building and activities available.
Staff was attentive and willingly accommodating.
We will soon stay here in our next visit.
If you go at ngiht, there is a light show in the bay that was spectacular.
It is very fancy, with all the amenities you could think of.
There's a free mini cone ice-cream while our check-in.
Overall is good but just wait too long upon check in time.
The breakfast as always, a very large spread, everyone prefers the main restaurant, hence bit of queuing though.
The service was personalized.
They even make a new towel animal everyday for you!
MBS is a huge complex, above and below the surface, an architectural icon that could easily fail as a hotel by becoming impersonal, but quite the opposite is the case.
The menu is pricey but you are paying for that spectacular view.

Itâ€™s something to behold.
A must if in Singapore!
All that does not matter match when you are in the hotel.
CON:  Rooms are small and not particularly luxurious by Singapore standards.

There are tons of people all the time and it feels like you are swimming in someone else's bathwater.

I have to be honest: this is not a luxury property though price per night might make you think it is.
So, I you expect the best service and a good value for your money, go to the Four Seasons or the St Regis.
This is a very expensive hotel and it's not exclusive at all.
Maybe social media seduced you (yeah, that's how I fell for it) and you wanna try it, which is ok, but take this into consideration before booking and spending your money.

Too crowded, feels more like a shopping centre or an airport rather than a hotel.

Too many restrictions, even for guests (can't use pool after check-out)
It might be a bit pricey but is worth every penny.
Everything was a jaw dropping eye opener.
As per the title of my review OMG!
We stayed here at the Marina Suites on October of 2013, travelling with family and friends came to visit!
Must stay hotel if you are visiting Singapore.
Arrived to the hotel early, at around 9:00, but was lucky to receive the keys anyways.
However, you have to be careful about accidentally using it taking something that costs money.
When ordering food, be aware that things like ketchup costs extra money.

Rude people, ignorant people, some courteous people, and a few smiles from staff.
The rooms are OK.
Constantly drops out.
they want from S$140 up......
and then they want your passport to pick up the card!!!
Being an F1 fan and seeing this place during the race coverage, it was added to my bucket list of places to visit and to have a plunge in the infinity pool.
The hotel is large, consisting of three towers with over 40 floors in each, so the number of guests is very high.
Most of the facilities have been designed for these numbers, so things worked mostly OK.
For those things one could pay that money (once), but for other (or longer) stays there are better luxury options in Singapore, and for (far?) less money.
Rooms higher up are more expensive, and rooms lower are less expensive.
Our Group of 7 paid a visit to the bar at the top of Marina Bay Sands.
The view is undoubtedly spectacular!
Iâ€™m not sure the view is that much better?!
Its got great view and big space, view is amazing however, they restrict your entry for infinity pool for not more than what amount of access cards you hold.
With it being this expensive to live here and limitation to accessibility.

The rooms were nice a big however our bags were delivered to the room late, someone came in the room to check if the mini bar was stocked instead of doing this prior to our arrival and there were a few finishing issues particularly with the hotel guest internet service not working and the air con controls in the room not responding...not to mention the check in being inefficient.
but it is a long way off for being classed as an elite hotel of the world, especially for the money you pay...worth it for the swimming pool....
We even got a complimentary upgrade to a bigger room and a nice chocolate cake served in our room since we had an anniversary.
When you are going to the infinity pool make sure to catch sunrise and sunset (wait for the buildings to open their lights up).
The pool gets crowded at peak hours like 5-8pm

The hotel itself is a destination!
The breath taking view of the Singapore skyline from the infinity pool is unparalleled.
The entire stay was unforgettable and staying in MBS is something Iâ€™m looking forward to again when I visit SG.
We were able to upgrade the room and had a killer view of the city and the bay!
Itâ€™s close to everything, thereâ€™s an MRT station right below you, and a food court if you donâ€™t want to pay top notch prices.
There are 3 which is awesome but I wish there were more selections.
The international buffet was not what I was expecting, I was let down.
I was expecting more selections like breakfast sandwiches (maybe Iâ€™m just homesick and looking for American breakfast foods).
I would return!
This is a huge iconic property in Singapore.
For me, MBS is the pinnacle of any stay in Singapore.
Would recommend sharing a continental or full english if you're not a big eater.
Plenty of food to share
Rooms are very spacious even if (in my opinion) not aligned with a real 5 stars hotel.
It's useful to say that you pay only for the rooftop pool: this is only the reason why you should book only 1 night here in your lifetime.
I've tried all the restaurants and i can say that they are all fine, but nothing extreme excellent.
